alert.note: Alert for Carter; Comanche; Cotton; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 02 at 8:21PM CDT until May 02 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Comanche County in southwestern Oklahoma... Garvin County in southern Oklahoma... Southern Grady County in central Oklahoma... Stephens County in southern Oklahoma... Northeastern Cotton County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northwestern Carter County in southern Oklahoma... West central Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Northern Murray County in southern Oklahoma... South central McClain County in central Oklahoma... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 821 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Byars to 6 miles west of Foster to 7 miles east of Geronimo, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Southeastern Lawton, Duncan, Pauls Valley, Marlow, Walters, Lindsay, Wynnewood, Comanche, Stratford, Geronimo, Maysville, Rush Springs, Bray, Temple, Roff, Elmore City, Wayne, Velma, Paoli and Katie. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Comanche; Cotton; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Stephens
